comment.text:
WORTH. THE. WAIT. 

Franklin Barbecue is one of the most if thee not the most famous BBQ spot in all of Texas. And does the hype live up to its name? You bet! We went on the Tuesday after Memorial Day around 10 am. There was already a long line of about 50 people. Franklin's provides lawn chairs for guests to use, so my friend and I grabbed one and waited it out. We finally got to the front of the line at 12 pm. We basically ended up getting 1 of everything. Here a few things that stood out to me:

- Brisket: best brisket I have ever had!! Smokey, fatty, succulent, you name it. When you take a bite, it just melts in your mouth

- Pork Ribs: again, like the brisket.. smokey and cooked to perfection. fall off the bone type of rib. meat is tender as it can get.

- Pulled Pork: tender and smokey as well

- Key Lime Pie: they put a good amount of lime because it was very tart but not overly tart. perfect amount of sweetness and great way to cool off after such a rich-flavored meal

-Ruby's Dang Pie (Coconut Pineapple Pie): Very coconutty. Sweetness from the candied pineapples

Overall, the hype is real and it is worth the wait whenever you are in Austin. Just make sure to go early so they don't sell out before you get to the front!

Is the wait really worth it? Yes. Probably the best BBQ, ever! And I had a lot of BBQ from all over, the most recent was a month ago in Kansas City. 

We ended up waiting about three and a half hours in line from start to finish. Got in line on a Tuesday at about 8:30am and was number 14 and 15 in line.  They had plenty of lawn chairs for you to borrow while waiting. At about 9:00am or so they opened up the inside for you to use bathroom, buy some swag, get water (free) or buy drinks. A Franklin employee also goes through the line and takes a preliminary order from everyone. They tally up how much brisket, ribs, sausages, etc. are being ordered so that if you're one of the later people in line they can let you know if you will get your share for that day. Super mindful of people's time! 

Once you are finally inside after 11:00am, you won't feel rushed to order your food at the counter. Everything is measured by the pound and sliced to order. There's plenty of seatings inside and outside. The restaurant isn't big by any means, but the flow of the line was efficient that there will be tables available when you are ready to sit down and eat. 

For two people, we ordered the Ruby's Dang pie, potato salad, pinto beans, half pound of brisket, ribs, pulled pork, and jalapeño cheddar sausage. That was plenty of food, we ended up having some extra to take back. My favorite was the pie, then brisket. A close third was the jalapeño cheddar sausage. Absolutely delicious and amazing. The brisket was just the most tender meat I've had in my life. 

If waiting in line is not your thing, you can always order in advance, with a minimum of 5 pounds of meat. Pick up location is in the back and is separate from the line. My friend did that, but I think she had to wait about 20-30 minutes after arriving for the order to be ready. 

Will definitely go back to Austin just for Franklin BBQ. Seriously!
Waited in the infamous line and I can say that it's truly worth the wait. The brisket is unbelievably good, you gotta go at least once in your life!

There is a reason this is a legendary establishment. Well, there are actually quite a few!

Every cut of meat is at least among the best in its class. The brisket and ribs are the standard of BBQ excellence. They have almost no peers to match their balance of salt, savory, sweet, and succulent. However, let me tell you that turkey is the best turkey that I've ever had. Everyone brags about the red meats in TX, but this turkey is as good as any meat you'll eat anywhere. Do not add sauce to anything! It came without sauce because it is wonderful on its own. Try the pies for dessert. Nothing compliments the meat's savory goodness as much as a wonderfully sweet desert from a local bakery like Cake and Spoon! 

I've visited Franklin's a couple of times now, both on weekdays. You can comfortably arrive by 930 and be done eating by noon. That didn't used to be the case (you had to arrive by 8am) but the benefit of having so many excellent BBQ options in Austin is that it thins all lines! Any amount of waiting is worth it for this wonderful BBQ. Staff greets you in line and takes preliminary orders to predict how far their food will go. They do run out of meat so arrive early. Maybe a dozen complimentary folding chairs are available for early folks. The line is mostly under an awning and is on the west side of the building so you won't get any direct summer sun, and you'll be mostly covered by rain if you get here early enough. Parking is much harder the later you arrive.

Don't eat dinner, grab a friend, get here early, make a new friend in line, and eat as much of everything on the menu as possible!

I read other Yelp reviews so knew what to expect. If you come around 8 am there will be 30-40 people already in line but I think that's ok. I went on a Friday and they first people got in line at 5:30 am which I don't think is worth it. I got there at 8:10 am and about 35 people ahead of me. Note there are complimentary folding chairs available under the stairs for you to use. They open the side door so you can use the bathroom and buy drinks or merchandise. 

A worker took our pre-order to let people know when brisket will run out. You still must place your order once you get inside. 10 minutes before the doors open at 11 am they will tell everyone to return the chairs and stand up against the wall. The doors open at 11 and you wait for the line to move. One person slices every type of meat you want so it is a slow process. Another person adds any sides you want. The cashier adds any drinks or pies plus rings you up. By the time I got my food it was 11:55 am. The workers are very friendly and the meat carver will chat with you as they slice the meats. 

There are some tables inside and outside. Tables turn over relatively quickly as people realize they ordered too much like I did! I got 1/2 lb each of brisket and pork ribs. 1/4 lb each of pulled pork and turkey. The brisket was soft, moist, smokey and had a nice bark. It's everything you want from a brisket! The pork ribs were also very good being fall off the bone soft with smokey flavor. The pulled pork was ok. I prefer Hawaiian kalua pig more! The turkey had a smokey flavor with pepper outside. It wasn't dry which is always the worry with turkey. 

I got pinto beans on the side which were just ok. I got a bourbon banana pie but was so full I didn't get to eat it yet!

Is the wait worth it? I'd say yes if you're from out of Texas and don't have access to good barbecue. If you're from Texas maybe it's not worth it as there are many other places or preorder to not have to deal with the line. 

It was an expensive meal but one I don't regret! Nice to splurge and treat yourself very now and then, especially when on vacation!

I've avoided this place do to the wait times but discovered during the week waiting only 15-20 minutes. Upon entering the staff is friendly and attentive, seating is limited both inside and outside, the worst part was parking. Expect to spend your money here, I had brisket, pork ribs, sausage and potato salad. The brisket and ribs were some of the best, potato salad average, the sausage not so much. I'll definitely be returning for the brisket and ribs, highly recommended.

photos.caption: Brisket, ribs, sausage and potato salad

comment.text:
So, we came to town from Cali and of course we had to try this place out since it was highly recommended.  We got there at 10am since there only open for 3hrs. We got there and there was already 75 people in line waiting.  This is the only time I'd wait for anything.  We heard that people got there at 8am.  It took us almost 3hrs to get in an order and sit down. The ran out of Beef Ribs.  We ordered the Turkey, Ribs, Brisket, Pork Square Ribs, Sausage (Jalapeño, Cheese) , Pulled Pork, and our sides were potato salad, Beans, and Coleslaw. 

Brisket, Pulled Pork, Ribs-tender, Smokey, good bark, and great flavor
Turkey-great flavor and tender
Sausage- were not bad, Jalapeño one was much better
Potato salad was just okay. Potato salad needed some seasoning. 
Beans were pretty good. 
Coleslaw-was dry and needed some seasoning.  

The sides option was very limited, I would've love some greens or Mac n cheese which is a staple when it comes to BBQ.  

The BBQ sauces were pretty good.

At least you could get beers while you wait and they provided chairs which was awesome 

For the most part it was excellent just like the staff. Kudos. 

I would give it 5 Stars on the meats and the service but overall because of everything I had to give it a 4stars.  I would recommend at least going to this place if your in town.  I also recommend preordering if you want buy 5 pounds or more. Hardly any wait.

photos.caption: My dude working hard and being very cordial and entertaining.
Ribs, Turkey, Brisket, sausage, Pulled Pork, Beans, Potato Salad, Coleslaw, Bread.

comment.text:
As everyone has said, YES -THERE IS A LINE.
We waited 3 hours. Would we do it again? Prob not, but would do the phone order. 
Why: because it's that good!!!

The only thing I can add that some of the other reviews didn't mention is the espresso sauce isn't bottled. I asked the staff why and apparently the espresso is brewed and won't last when bottled. Yes, it was my favorite too.

While you wait outside, they have water and portable chairs/umbrellas to borrow (if avail). They also sell drinks outside while you wait. 
All the rubs, sauces, and other merch are avail inside for you to buy when you are STILL in line.

Got here about 30 minutes before opening and the line was already to the parking lot! Two workers were going down the line taking a tally of meats ppl were going to order and told us that it would be about 2 1/2 hours wait till we could even get to the counter! I thought no way hut it really did take that long! Was it worth? 1000% worth it! The Brisket was like cotton candy damn near but meat! It was INSANE! How they do that?! The ribs was falling off the bone every time i grabbed a piece! Worth the wait ! The staff was so friendly and the restaurant just had homey vibes to it! Coming back next time I'm in Austin!

Got to Franklin's Bbq at around 1015pm and there was already a long line to the end of the parking lot. There's a staff member that informed you if there will be certain cuts of meat available to you depending on your place in line. After 2 hrs wait, i finally got to the inside. There's only space for one person to cut the meat and you are ordering from that person. That's the main reason why the line is so long. 

Ordered 1.5lb of beef rib, 1lb of brisket, 1lb of pork ribs, 1 pull pork sandwich, and three sausages for 3 ppl. The amount of food was a bit much, had two slices of brisket left over. I enjoyed the beef rib the most. It falls off the bone and super easy to chew. Brisket is okay. The pork ribs, pull pork and sausages were meh, nothing special or out of the ordinary. Dont think it's worth waiting 2hrs in line for average bbq.

photos.caption: Beef rib, brisket, sasuage, pork rib, pull pork sandwich
Interior with only one meat cutter, which makes the line so long

comment.text:
-Giving this a 5 because nothing compares back in CA, and the workers are incredibly friendly!!

*Beef Ribs are only on weekends and are limited in supply (~30)
*They provide lawn chairs for you to sit and wait in before they open
*Doors will open at 9 for merch/drinks/restroom


Sunday 
8:15am- 30th in line
11:00am- OPENED
11:40am- Received Food

What I ordered for 2 people:
1/2 lb brisket
1/4 lb pork rib
1 beef rib (1.1 lb)
1 jalapeño sausage 
+
Cole slaw
Bread


Went back-to-back with Terry Blacks to compare

BETTER at FRANKLIN:

Brisket- What people wait in line for, and deservedly so. THE BEST of all the meats tried. Perfectly seasoned and tenderized. Easily the star of the show.

Beef Rib- For all you heavy meat lovers, this is for you. The fattiness can be quite overwhelming, so best to share amongst 2-3 people


BETTER at TERRY BLACKS:
Jalapeño sausage- Franklin sausage lacked much flavor, and was a little dry

All the sides!!- Franklin basically kicked this aspect to the curb.. don't expect much from these


TIE:
Pork Rib- all depends what you like

Franklin if you care more about meat texture- soft and fell off the bone!

Terry Black if you care more about flavor- seasoning and sauce was superior


Overall, it was quite the fun experience waiting in line and mingling with other customers. Something about waiting in line together BEFORE opening makes it more tolerable. Also thankful for the shade!


Tl; dr:
Meat lovers- go to Franklin 

No patience to wait in line and want a complete meal with sides? - go to Terry Blacks

photos.caption: 1.1 lb Beef Rib 0.5 lb Beef Brisket 0.25 lb Pork Rib 1 Jalapeño sausage link

comment.text: Best damn brisket I've ever had the pleasure of tasting. Perfection. So tender, rich and flavorful. Good ol' Texas barbecue. Yum.

This place has been on my bucket list for a very long time. I fully enjoyed the full experience from the long line to ordering and the awesome BBQ. What a cool place and the service was excellent. What I thought was really cool was that as you're in line, the staff comes up to you and they let you know what's available or what should be available or not by the time you order. Fortunately, everything was available when we ordered. What I can tell you is that was some of the best BBQ I've ever had. As for the brisket it was the best I have ever had. What I also liked about Franklins was the location and rustic look to the place. They offer indoor and outside seating on picnic tables. I truly enjoyed Franklins and the food. Also do not miss out of the deserts that they offer. I had the Ruby's Dang Pie and it was Dang good. Unfortunately they were out of the Pecan Pie.

photos.caption: This is what happens if you come late.
Rib and brisket with potato salad.

comment.text: The best of the best top dog . I came here with a friend . And picked up for other friends as well spent 900 bucks on bbq most I've ever spent at on food . They were all super nice people couldn't ask for a better staff I can't wait to come back

Did a takeout order for Franklin BBQ and managed to snag 2 lbs of brisket, 2 lbs of jalapeno cheddar sausage, and 1 original sausage and a quart of chopped brisket. Sadly all the pork ribs and pulled pork were out, so we didn't get to try that.

To be honest, I thought the food was pretty mediocre. My favorite was the jalapeno cheddar because the cheddar oozed out of the sausage. The brisket, which I was super excited for, was super moist, but also super salty. I preferred the dry rub ones I've had in Nashville and probably should have had bbq sauce with it, although none was included. The meat ended up sitting super heavy and salty. We had bbq the night before at a Japanese restaurant, and the group agreed that was the superior bbq. Although we were a group of 8, we didn't end up finishing any of the meat. The sides of potato salad, bbq beans, coleslaw were all okay. They also included a loaf of wonder bread.

Although we ordered pickup and arrived before our order time, it still took 30+ mins to get our order because they slice it up on the spot. Fun for an experience but I'd feel gipped if I waited 5 hours for the food.

This is great BBQ, but chances are you already knew that. You probably already know this place has 2-3hr wait times as soon as it open at 11 am. If you want to bypass that, order ahead. There is a 5 lb min, but plan ahead and you won't regret it. Look for a green trailer parked behind the long line of people and you'll find designated parking and picnic tables for eating.

Hands down the best BBQ in all of Texas. Anyone that says otherwise (including locals) are simply wrong and say this because of the wait. If Franklins didn't have a wait, I guarantee everyone would agree this is by far the best BBQ. I tried all the top BBQ joints in Texas and Franklins took the cake by miles. Meat is cooked perfectly and has the most flavor out of all the BBQs I've tried. Perfect balance of bark, smoke, seasoning, and fat! This place is definitely worth the wait. Get in line around 730-8am and you'll be golden. There's a reason this place is so we'll known, they know what they're doing! 

PS: I got there at 630am on a Saturday and instantly made friends in line. The wait is part of the experience. Bring some beers and a chair and you'll have a great time waiting for the best BBQ. Around 8-830am is when the line really picks up and the risk of food selling out becomes real.

photos.caption: Brisket, Beef Rib, Pork Ribs, Pulled Pork, Jalapeño Cheddar Sausage, Cole Slaw, Bourbon Banana Pie

comment.text: Best bbq in the world! From the Turkey to the Jalepeno cheddar links to the Brisket,   Franklins will change your life for the better ,your friends will notice a difference in you

Review #800 for me should be something special, so let's celebrate at Franklin Barbecue! And I even got the VIP tour!

Years in the wishing, I finally planned this foodie trek by myself from Cali to Texas to try Franklin Barbecue. I'm no BBQ expert, but after trying Texas Top 50 BBQ place Tyler's BBQ in Amarillo years ago, I had to come back and try more BBQ. So many strong spots on that stretch from San Antonio to Lockhart to Austin, but Franklin is where the new traditionalist movement started! 

Try to get there an hour before it opens and earlier on weekends and holidays. Typically you'll wait that hour plus another 60-90 minutes so total wait time could be up to 2.5 hours. I came on a Tuesday and arrived about 20 minutes before they opened at 11:00 am. Some people have lawn chairs set up for the wait and there is a place to stash them under the stairwell while you go in and eat. About 15-30 minutes before the restaurant opens, someone comes out to take your pre-order and can help you to estimate the wait time. This is not an order you have to hold hard and fast to, it is basically to get an idea of who wants what meet and at what point they might run out of certain meats. When you get to the counter inside, you can choose to do more or less meat than your original plan if you want. 

It was supposed to be about 90 minutes for me to get to the counter after the restaurant opened but the line moved fast and it was only another hour. Total wait time on my Tuesday including pre-opening... 1 hour 20 minutes. Waiting in line is part of the fun. You get to meet locals and travelers and talk meat. Once inside, you can see all the other fun stuff they have for sale... BBQ Sauce, dry rub, charcoal briquets, t-shirts, hats, cookbooks, mugs, cafeteria trays and even a smoker! I picked up shirts, sauce and the sky blue cafeteria tray which I thought was a random and cool way to serve up bbq at a future house party. Did you know you can even buy refrigerated brisket slabs for $170 that are ready for you to take and bake?

Meat is sold by weight, sausages are sold in whole links.

Brisket ($34/lb) - If you aren't here for the brisket, then what are you doing? The brisket takes 42 hours to prepare, including 14 slow smoked hours in the smoker. That blackened crust on the outside where the peppercorns glisten like black diamonds, my God. Under that is a layer of fat that melts before you can cut it and under that is a thick, dark pink smoke ring. They cut you some of both, lean and moist (fatty) and both are wonderful. The brisket is well-seasoned, juicy and smokey and needs no BBQ sauce. 

Pork Ribs ($30/lb) - I loved the pork rib. The whole thing was a pink smoke ring all the way through. Its brine and coat seemed more tangy than the brisket but also equally smokey and wonderful. The meat did fall off the bone after I bit into it. 

Jalapeno Cheddar Sausage - I got this just to try something different but it blew me away. Smokey, strong jalapeno kick, juicy gobs of white cheddar oozing out on the inside as my knife broke through. Must get if you love a spicy sausage!

Coleslaw - This was aite. I needed some veggies to break up the meat party it. It's not heavily coated in creamy sauce so it did the job. 

Potato Salad - Creamy with a little mustard mixed in, I liked it. 

Bourbon Banana Tart - They get these from Cake and Spoon and these are must get. Just take it home if you can't fit it in your stomach. Smooth banana cream with the bourbon activator that makes it full flavored. The crust was thick but crumbly and still a little graham cracker crunchy when I had it two days later. It is sooo good. 

BBQ Sauces - They have Original, Spicy, Vinegar, Espresso. Original was my favorite. Spicy is mildly spicy. Vinegar was too watery and sour for me. Espresso is very interesting because it is infused with coffee flavor. They did it well, but I still prefer original or spicy. Their original sauce is lightly sweet and a bit more tart than other joints' original sauce. 

After eating I ventured out back hoping to take a peek at their smokers and they said, "Go upstairs ask them for a tour, they can probably give you one." WHAT the WHUT?

I took myself back up to the dining room and ask if it was possible to get a tour. They said, "Sure! Just wait outside this door." 

By that time most people had been served and it wasn't too hectic. One of their master smokers opened the door and let me in. They have five submarine like smokers that had 106 briskets in them when I was there. They are always working on about 200 briskets at any given time, whether smoking or prepping. The room is always around 85 degrees so it's insanely hot in the summer.

So that was my awesome trip! 

***Hot Tip - Go at 1 pm if you only want brisket and there might be no line!***

photos.caption: Meat by the Pound Menu - December 2022
Pie Menu - December 2022 (get the Banana Bourbon!)
Chilled Briskets for take home. $170 - December 2022

comment.text:
Hub and I got there at 8:30am to wait in line since everyone say the line can be crazy. We were about 4th group in line which was great. One of the positive thing is that they have camp chairs for customers to use while waiting in line. 

Friendly, helpful and great recommendations from all the staffs. 

We ordered little of everything on the menu. The ribs are amazing, lots of favor in each item. Turkey was a little dry, but it's ok.  Ordered one of each of the sausage and we wished we ordered more to take home.  I'm not big fan of the potatoes salad. We were alittle bum that the day we went they do not make beef ribs, but we will need to go back to try it.

Top tier Texas BBQ but be prepared to wait for hours! Can be hard to find seating with how busy it gets too. BBQ is obviously a must in Austin if you're visiting. Locals love this place too, although some will say it's not worth the wait. My friend was adamant about coming to this specific BBQ place because he had been once before and LOVED it. We got up super early and waited in line from 8am until they opened, and then waited about 1 hour til we got to the front of the line. The line was SO long people had brought chairs to wait early in the morning.

We ordered meat and sides all to share. The meat was so tender it glides right off my fork, as it should. And so juicy & flavorful! They have 4 different sauces. My only disappointment is that they didn't have Mac n cheese! Their potatoes and beans were great though.

Would recommend only if you're down to wait a long time. Some locals recommended similar BBQ places with shorter wait times, and I haven't tried those so I can't compare.

Phenomenal  The pickles were crinkle cut, not too sweet or salty, but perfectly balanced. I don't like when they're completely drowned in brine - as you can see from the pic, these were not, but still perfectly juicy. The onions were a nice bright white, thinly sliced, sharp flavor. I've had many onions throughout the city and these hands down take the cake. Me and my buddies couldn't stop grabbing handfuls and monching them. We've been talking about them ever since! Great portion size on both (an entire plastic tub of each). The meat was good too

Franklin Barbecue was on a lot of "must try on your visit to Austin" blogs while planning where to go. So naturally, I was inclined.

What these blogs failed to mention is how long the wait would be! I got there at opening and still waited 2 hours in line. One of the people working there informed us that we would likely only be served the brisket and the links based on our position in line and they were correct.

It does get very packed so I had to camp out spots and wait for people to finish eating to find a seat. When we did sit down to eat, the food was to die for! The brisket was so tender it felt like it melted on my tongue. If I had one complaint, it would be that the brisket was a little salty. 

Overall, if you haven't been then you definitely need to check out this Austin BBQ staple at least once!
I thought this place would be over hyped...I was beyond wrong. Amazing bbq and amazing people. It's been three weeks and I still dream about the brisket and pork ribs. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Beef rib, pork ribs, brisket, turkey, jalapeños sausages, Pulled Pork

comment.text:
I've waited in line for cronuts, Saturday Night Live, Hamilton tickets, and finally Franklin BBQ, which was perhaps the most worthwhile wait of all. 

The wait:

My boyfriend and I got in line at 8:10 AM on a Friday in March 2023 and there were already 30 people in line. (We had food in hand at 11:47 AM.) People quickly started showing up behind us. They give out chairs and bottles of water, making for one of the most luxurious waiting experiences I've ever had. 

The food:

They take your meat order while on line, and you add sides, pies, etc at the counter. We opted for:

+ Brisket - 3/4 lb
+ Ribs - 1/2 lb
+ Sausage - 1 link
+ Potato salad - single 
+ Slaw - single
+ Pinto beans - single 
+ Key lime pie 
+ Strawberry rhubarb pie
+ Free pickles

The brisket was obviously the best thing we ate, and definitely the most incredible brisket I've ever had. Other standouts were the sausage, potato salad and strawberry rhubarb pie. Don't sleep on the free pickles, either! It was more than enough food for the two of us, and we even had some leftovers. 

We also went on the pit tour after we ate, which was awesome.

The verdict:

So so worth it!

Meat! We had a buddy get there at 8am to wait in line to place our order for lunch to be seated around Noon. We got the brisket, smoked turkey, pulled pork, ribs, and their jalapeno cheddar sausage links. Comes with slices of wonder bread and they have a sauces and pickles on the side. Food by the pound. All of it was great. You could see the smoke rings. Wasn't a fan of the turkey but I imagine it would be much better if it was sliced a bit thinner. The link were great but the casing was a bit tough. All of the meat is carved in front of you. As we were leaving we heard one of the guys telling people waiting in line that they were going to be sold out of the brisket by the time they got to order. 

Its a tiny place, if you want brisket, get here early. We were a group of 7, we didn't finish our plate so we took it all home and I won't lie - it was better the second time around when we made mini sliders.

Had to go back to to give Franklin's another shot fresh from the store. We waited about 3 hours total from the time we got to the restaurant to our table (which is pretty standard for Franklin). 

For a party of 5 we ordered 2lb pork ribs, 2.5lbs brisket, 1lb sausage and .5lb turkey, quart of coleslaw, pint of bean and pint of potato salad and it was more than enough! Plenty of leftovers which is always welcomed. 

Again the rib really shined, it was everyone's favorite by far and the perfect amount of spice/fat and fell right off the bone. The brisket is really great but I don't know if it is truly the best in Austin. The spicy sausage had the perfect snap to it and was absolutely delicious. All sauces were great and really made the meal. 

Only down side is the sides. A BBQ place without mac n cheese is a crime in my book. Between that and the long wait that you can avoid at other places I gave it 4/5 but realistically a 4.5/5, you won't regret the wait it is truly delicious.

photos.caption: Pulled pork, Brisket, and Ribs  Coleslaw, Pinto Beans  and potatoe salad

comment.text:
There's not much to be said about Franklin BBQ that hasn't already been said 
If it's not on your bucket list it should be, the counter girls keep on smiling even though the line never ends they give every patron the experience they're looking for.

This is legit the best brisket! And the other food looked just as delicious. The choices of sauces were good too! 

We're in town for work and had to go here. We went to Terry Blacks last trip. So, it was Fraklins this trip. And it was life changing brisket. How do they make meat taste like buttery melt in your mouth goodness? Literally, this has been the highlight of the trip so far. Because of course the first weekend here they would be on that whole ice storm watch. 

The line is legit, y'all,and we came at like 10:30. I realize they're going for authentic and originality with the set-up. But that food is so good they can move the kitschy roadside barbecue joint into an upgrade to accommodate more space inside. Like don't upgrade the smokers. Just upgrade or enlarge the restaurant area. 

While you wait look at the roof near the door. Next to the sign that says "road-trip" someone wrote "kill more cows I want beef ribs". That's because by the time it got to us there were no more beef ribs, and I think I heard a collective moan at this announcement. What is it like they only have ten beef ribs each weekend day? C'mon, make more beef ribs! The people's trays with the beef ribs I saw looked so good! I was even considering Hunger Games style contest for the beef ribs! 

The entire experience was legit. The smoke ring and seasoning on the brisket were the stuff legends are made of. I got a subscription to Master Class for Christmas, and now I'm going to watch the Franklin's guy's class. And by the way he was there today! This is a work trip and if this is the highlight of the trip I am count this as successful!

I would give this place 5 stars but I'm knocking it down 1 star because the way they have structured their business is extremely inefficient. They have one counter trying to serve 100s of people who are waiting in 100 degree weather. They don't have misters outside or anything like that (which plenty of bars nearby do) and they don't even bother dusting the couple of fans that they have outside so they are caked with dead skin cells and bacteria. With how much money they are charging and by effect making they should be able to make the conditions people are waiting in much better in my opinion. 

With that being said the brisket was hands down the best brisket I've ever had in my life, holy shit it was so good. The ribs and the jalapeño sausage was also top tier. I personally didn't like any of the barbecue sauces (too vinegary for my taste) but my friends liked them. 

Overall the bbq was amazing but I personally won't be coming here during the summer heat because of their lack of accommodations for people waiting in line. But I'd definitely come back when it's not so hot outside.

The meat really is exceptionally tender and it does taste good - BUT, all in all it was just too salty for me.  I do like the atmosphere and I was surprised to find that the 2 hour wait in line went by so quickly. But yeah...salty.

After having tasted several types of bbq, hands down, this is 100% the RealDeal! 
We ordered the turkey, ribs, & brisket for our protein. We tried the pickled jalapeño peppers- spicy & delicious. Coleslaw - crisp & cool in the 100+ degree weather. Beers were ice cold! I have been disappointed with smoked turkey in the past. This made us want to order smoked turkey for Thanksgiving. A friendly staff made the experience that much nicer. Thank you Franklin's. We look forward to our next feast.

I ordered brisket, beef rib & pork ribs & beans. I loved the beef rib the best & brisket also. I had to stand in line for at least 2.5 hours before getting inside to order. I was in line before 10:00 am. 
Was it worth standing in line for that long? I believe so. I will probably go back if I ever come back to Austin. I hope I do.

We did pick up (ordering 5lbs of meat min). Pick up was a breeze because we got the meat before they're even opened. 

We ordered: brisket, pork rib, pulled pork, original links, jalapeños links. 

The brisket was so moist, even the flats are moist. I ordered 2lbs. Are 3 slices and took the rest back to La lol. 

The pork rib is something I don't really care for. Maybe it'll be better once I take it back home. 

Pulled pork was wonderful. It was super soft and juicy. Paired great with that vinegar sauce. 

Both of the links were pretty good too. I'm not usually a links type of girl. 

All these food came with a whole loaf of bread. 

The bourbon banana tart was a great as a midnight snack. I was too full to attempt to eat it on the same sitting. 

The coleslaw was a fail. It was quite flavorless.

I know this might trigger some, but I felt really let down by the hype surrounding Franklins. Came to TX intent on chowing down on some mind blowing bbq, and honestly, this wasn't it.

We drove in from Dallas specifically for Franklins. We were aware of the line and pre-ordered our meal so we could have a picnic. Pickup was between 12:30-1:00 and there was a line outside when we pulled up. 
For pre-orders, there is a trailer down the hill and behind the main restaurant. Despite the numerous warnings of not being able to eat pre-orders on site, there is a small, shaded patio with 2 picnic tables right next to the pickup area. 

We ordered: 
- 2lbs of ribs
- 2 sausage link (1 of each)
- 1 lbs pulled pork
-2 lbs. sliced brisket
-all of their sides: pinto beans, potato salad and slaw

Our thoughts:
- the sides were horrible, surprisingly had absolutely no flavor and bland
- brisket, although the bark was good; it was way too overdone and literally turned into mush the minute I ate it. I get that eventually my diet will be much softer but I while I still have my teeth I like being able to chew my food. 
- sausage: actually flavorful but overall dry
- pulled pork: super stringy and dry
-ribs: again, way overcooked and literally fell apart on the fork. But not in a good way

Service:
-staff was super friendly and was able to add in a loaf of bread to our order last minute

photos.caption: 1 lb brisket, 1lb pork ribs, 2 sausage links, 1 lb pulled pork

comment.text: First time coming to Austin so of course the 1st meal had to be Texas bbq. After doing some research we picked this place. The line wasn't bad according to some locals that were in the line but it still took an hour for us to get the foods. It's because there's only 1 meat cutter. We ordered some brisket, pork ribs, jalapeños cheddar sausage link, and 1 pecan pie. The pie was really good, perfect sweetness and crunchiness. For the meat, it's actually our first time eating Texas BBQ style meat so I'm rating only based on my preference, not on how they are supposed to taste. Surely the meat was tender and juicy but they were a little bit salty for us. Luckily the condiments helped balance them a little bit but we usually need some kind of sweetness in bbq meats. And the whole meal cost us $90 so it was quite a disappointment for us. But one great thing is everyone here was super nice and friendly.

The hype is real! Got in line at 9 waited until 11 until opening and was able to get the last beef rib which is a must try! This is considered by many to be the best BBQ in the world and people travel all over the world to get their hands on Franklins and you should to!

From the juicy brisket that I cut with a plastic fork... (yes a plastic fork) To the massive fall off the bone beef rib to the awesome selection of barbecue sauces this place is like heaven. If you are a bbq fan do yourself a favor and wait in the line because it's so worth it. 

We went to terry blacks aswell but franklins was twice as good all around and it was an absolute honor to visit this gold mine of a bbq spot. Till next time Franklin

Ok this is my 3rd time here in Austin. I was going to terry black because it was the best bbq I have had. Not any more this takes the top notch for best Bbq. It was delicious the brisket and pork ribs were incredible  I'll defer be back.

photos.caption: I have a new favorite place to eat BBQ

comment.text:
Ended up coming here after hearing all of the rave reviews about it and missing it last time!

Good:
- Had some of the juiciest brisket ever here, just mouth watering!
- Prices are reasonable for being such a famous place! 
- I like how the sauce is unlimited and you get free bread
- Fan of potato salad too 
- Nice outdoor seating, very casual vibes 

Bad:
- 1 hour wait 11 am Tuesday 
- Greasy and fat meats make you feel a little something after 
- The pulled pork and the ribs were just alright 

Overall I enjoyed my experience and glad I finally came!

BEST BBQ IN AUSTIN HANDS DOWN! WORTH THE 3 HOUR WAIT YES!! I got here Sunday at 830am. There was a line halfway down the side of the building already. This place doesn't even open till 11am. It was raining and cold but luckily on the side we were covered. They had chairs for us to sit and wait. For the folks who were lined up past the building the staff was nice and kind to bring out umbrellas for those who didn't have one. Once we got inside wow the smell of BBQ was so worth it. Sadly they already ran out of the big beef rib. We ended up getting ribs, brisket which was my favorite and some pulled pork. There was a guy lined up since 9pm the night before because he really wanted to big beef ribs.

Really tasty bbq! Here's a tip - come around 1pm, when the lines are less and still enough meat to enjoy without waiting for 3 hours. We got the beef brisket, small sides, and their pickled jalapeño (super spicy!). Definitely a stop to hit up if visiting Austin.

Delicious, spot on. 
Worth the wait.
Got in line at 10am on a Thursday, they open at 11
Great customer service, everyone including other customers were really friendly. 
We saw Franklin really quickly. That was really cool.

Would recommend.

Here's my take on it, just like everyone says, plan ahead and get there early.  As there is a heat wave going on, you're better off trying to get there so you can secure some shade for yourself. 

I'll admit, the line process isn't as good as you'd think, however, everyone ahead and behind is super kind and you have to go with it.  I noticed that there was a group of 4 guys and then it suddenly turned into a group of at least 10 people when their friends started showing up, which I suppose is a common thing now?

I arrived at 750am and waited until the restaurant opened which was probably another hour in line after it opened.  They open at 11:00am but depending on the wait you're still standing afterwards.

One thing I was impressed by was the amount of foldable/camping chairs located underneath the stairs due to the long wait prior to opening their doors.  And, everyone pretty much put them back where they got them from, that is unless you brought your own chair! 

It was fun being a part of this experience and they have a small shop for souvenirs. 

We ordered the tri tip, brisket, turkey, pulled pork and a beef rib (which btw, is only a weekend serving and they run out fast)!  We ordered more than enough where we had shared with a sibling of mine. 

There are signs posted everywhere stating you cannot take a table unless you've ordered your food and we were lucky to find a table on the inside as Austin is going through a heatwave.  I will say that I enjoyed their spicy sauce.   oh, their cole slaw was pretty good. 

Would I go here again?  Yes.  Would I wait as long as I did, no... but we would go back for sandwiches and dessert.
The hype is spot on this time.  The especially long wait is also worth it.  Make it an experience and wait it out or order takeout... either way, do not forget the brisket!
Wasn't blown away. Food was good but nothing over the top to wait that long. Brisket was the star but everything else was good but not gonna write home about it.

Wooow love me some Good Texas BBQ !!

We were in Austin for a conference and we had to hit up a local spot since everyone we talk to told us we just had to come here early in the morning .. reminds me of Wilenski's in MTL they are only open from 11-3pm and if you show up late you might end up with crumbs ... they sell out very fast

As we got here there was already a huge line up before they even opened and there was at least 50 people before us wow but the line goes fast

We decided to get the classics for Texas (Roast beef, pulled pork sandwich and beef ribs And some sides )

10/10 for the food it was just that amazing totally worth it and more. However I did prefer Terry Black's over Franklin's but I had to try both they were both amazing 
Pickles and onions are Free on the sides and all their sauces and all the tea you can drink 

I wish they were open later at night 

Service: Super nice and friendly true southern charm everyone's super nice and Howdy the place is very authentic to Texas and welcoming down to earth vibe

Overall : I definitely recommend this place if you're in Austin you must must give it a try !

My favorite bbq spot that I tried during the week I was in Texas. I came by around 1 pm on a Friday and everyone was also lined up so I decided to try my luck. They sold out of the sliced brisket a couple people before me in line but I was able to snag 2 of their lunch trays for $40. Such a great deal because it was my first time there so I was able to try a variety of their meats (chopped brisket, pulled pork, turkey, and sausage). It kept me fed for over a week lol

This brisket was legendary. Best brisket I've ever had. Although I do feel like my expectations were so astronomically high that I was disappointed that the brisket wasn't mindblowingly good. It was a little less than that. Nonetheless I was very satisfied. It had a nice smoke ring around the edges and the insides were so moist. The edges are my favorite part, and they were so well-seasoned and flavorful. 

We came at 2:15pm on a Friday and the line wasn't too bad. They were out of some meats, but still had brisket, sausage, and pulled pork. We were actually the second to last people in line and they ran out of brisket on the last person. Really friendly service!
We are not much into BBQ, but we liked a dinner we got here. We took food to our place, so cannot judge the service in there.

On the logistics, I got in line at 7:15am yesterday, was about 13th in line and was at the counter at 11:30am.  Was as expected.  Doors open at 9:30am for you to buy merch and use the bathrooms.  If you are waiting in line with a friend, I took a break around 9am and walked 5 minutes down the street for coffee at a coffee shop called "Try Hard" and that helped break up the time.  

On the food, the brisket met my expectations.  Had a nice smoke ring and was very tender.  My favorite pairing was with the spicy bbq sauce.  The vinegar sauce was second best.  The original sauce was boring.  I also read somewhere not to sleep on the turkey.  That was probably the best turkey I've ever eaten.  It's so juicy and when they cut it they dip it into this juice bath right before serving so it glistens.

The only letdown, and the reason I knocked off a star, was the pork ribs.  Like some of the other Yelp reviews say (and I wish I had read before going), they were so salty I couldn't eat them.  For the other meats you can taste the meat, but for the pork ribs, you are just hit with salt.  

On how much food to order.  1 lb of brisket was perfect for two.  If you want leftovers, do 1 and 1/4 or 1 and 1/2 lbs.  We ordered half a pound of turkey, would recommend getting 3/4 lbs.  And we got 1 lb of the pork ribs which was 5 bones.  We had two slices of brisket and just the ribs leftover.

Enjoyed the experience waiting in line, but probably wouldn't wait again for it now that I've had it.  It's good and worth the wait the first time.  But it's not *that* much better than some other places that don't have a wait.

photos.caption: Turkey, brisket, pork ribs and slaw (pickles and onions not shown).
